intro: Strempeliopsis cubensis, commonly known as the Cuban strempeliopsis, is a flowering plant native to Cuba. It belongs to the family Campanulaceae and is characterized by its bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pale blue. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests and stream sides. It has opposite, ovate leaves with a smooth texture and produces small, clustered fruits. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
